turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Max, sit down. You're in no shape to kill anybody.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I want to cut his throat.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: It's already been cut.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Then I'll cut his balls off.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: ...His money - steal that, you steal his blood... Could you see his face when everything he worked so hard to get got snatched?  If we knew where he hid it.  Anyway, steal from him they'd pick up the whole prison and shake it sideways.  We couldn't hide it anywhere.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You know where it is?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I know where it is.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: 'Dem dat hides can finds says I'... I seen him, the clever tit, sneaking looks at it late at night, talking to it.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Yeah? Where?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Hishradyo.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Max - where?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: His radio Back of his open, radio...

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Just got some news on Bell.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Bad. Sent to the City Hospital. They ruptured his hernia again.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Oh shit.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Why the suit?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Maybe he's changing jobs.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: I think I've been poisoned.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: And you ate two baclavas, right? I not to touch them, mine was awful.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Look, I think I'm going to have to go to the john again.  You go on through, I'll catch up.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Never was anybody like you...

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: You can't take anything seriously.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: You're right.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Billy, what's the matter?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: My passport!

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Susan - forget it. Go get us a seat on the plane. Now.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: What is it? . . . Billy?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: For Christ's sake, just GET on the plane, okay!

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Billy - you'll just make yourself crazy.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Take it off! Take it off!  ...S'il vous plait?...

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: What is it with you man, what the hell is it?

turns.speaker: ZIAT
turns.text: Cat, ah!  Ayip!

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: You're ayip!

turns.speaker: ZIAT
turns.text: Look, you don't fuck with me, I don't fuck with you, right?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: But you fuck with me. You fuck with me all the time. You make crummy tea.  You rip us off on the hash.

turns.speaker: ZIAT
turns.text: I make special tea for you, Hiyes, okay?  We've to live like brothers. We have to be in here together.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Oh shove it, Ziat for all the money you have, you have nothing!

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Know what?

turns.speaker: ZIAT
turns.text: Was..  ...seven years old. I was on street in Suk.  Buy.  Sell.  No family to take care. I learn.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Learn what?

turns.speaker: ZIAT
turns.text: Dog eat dog, Hi-yes. You fuck other man before he fuck you.  And you must fuck last.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: That's a great philosophy.

turns.speaker: ZIAT
turns.text: You 'Merican.  You don't know.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Hey, Ziat, hurry up with the tea will ay!

turns.speaker: ZIAT
turns.text: Work, work, work, that's all do

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: I don't hear you bitch about the money.

turns.speaker: YESIL
turns.text: Vilyum, I am Necdit Yesil.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Mr. Yesil.

turns.speaker: YESIL
turns.text: I know exactly what you feel but you must not worry, we are acting immediately, we get the right court, the right judge,  I arrange everything - just right.  And I think we get you bail. If very bad, maybe twenty month sentence... But I think we get you bail...

turns.speaker: YESIL
turns.text: You know I have lectured at the University of Maryland in your country?  Also University Michigan Very nice country. We both go back.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: If I get bail, Mister Yesil, they say it's easy to cross the border into Greece?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: What'd the Prosecutor say?

turns.speaker: YESIL
turns.text: It's not important, just technical things. We make our case.  You were very good, you spoke well. The Judge like you. It look good. Don't worry.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Did you ask for bail?

turns.speaker: ERICH
turns.text: Lawyers?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Yeah... there's no straight lawyers in Turkey... They're all bent bent as hairpins...

turns.speaker: ERICH
turns.text: His name?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: ERICH
turns.text: The lawyer?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: What lawyer?

turns.speaker: ERICH
turns.text: Who got the Frenchman out?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Oh Yesil...  Yesil's his name but I...don't know anything... 'bout...Yesil...

turns.speaker: JEREMY
turns.text: Hey, you can't...

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: What's your name?

turns.speaker: JEREMY
turns.text: Jeremy...

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Okay, Jeremy...go get Dr. Chris Raymond, will you?

turns.speaker: JEREMY
turns.text: Lady...

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Did you hear me?  Get Dr. Raymond! NOW!!

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: The blintzes!  "Try the blintzes..."

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Selling your sould for a fistful of carbohydrates...

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Not just any carbohydrates, mind you. It was like being on the receiving end of some kind of transcendent oral sex.  We should get a strobe on this thing. Maybe even a siren.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Yeah, and a loudspeaker so you can yell "Epidemic! Epidemic! You're all going to die!"

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You really love flashing that thing, don't you?

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Hey. I'm a short guy. Waddaya want?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Internal hemorrage. 2 our of 5 have it.  No definite signs of TB, but we'll quarantine them a week just to make sure.

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Immigration's gonna love you for that.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Tell them to send flowers to the usual address.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Did they get the sleazebag who owns this place?

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Triad, Chinese Mafia. They bring people from Yunan. Slave labor...  Reverend Harry Wong, a preacher had the flophouse fronting for them. No sign of him.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: There are thirty five listed in the reverend Wong's roster...

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Shit.

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Peter...

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Yeah...?

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: There's some weird shit here.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Weird shit...?

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Take a look.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: You all watch your step.  We got some burrows goin' down seven stories here.  You fall, I don't wanna have to come pick you up.

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: New York's finest.

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: There's really people living down here?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Mole people. This section was pretty popular, all the way to Fulton Street...

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Funny.  Shoulda seen some track bunnies by now.

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Track bunnies.  Rats.  They're usually around.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Show that to the station manager.  Tell him Leonard's gonna have his bubble-butt he don't have someone down here in ten.

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: H-how do I get...?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Way we came.  Take the first tunnel to your right...

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Go left.  Go left again till you hit the fork... Then right again. You got that?

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: I think so. One right, two lefts...

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: And a right.

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Look, I showed you my badge...

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Yeah, and you gonna have to show me a lot bigger one you wanna go down there. That's the old maintenance grid, Doc. Swiss cheese: tunnels, tracks...

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: The Department of Public Health...

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: ...should know better'n to go sneakin' around my turf...

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Fine.  You want me to call your supervisor?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Please do.  He's a lonely guy.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Excuse me, I'm talking to you.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: No, you talkin' at me.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: For Chrissakes.  You gonna lay a two- bit bureaucratic, territorial number on me?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: You wanna keep up the conversation, you best come back with the proper permits and the right attitude.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: We'll be back at the platform in...

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: 20 minutes. If you don't go sight-seeing anymore.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: 20 minutes.  Susan?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Did you see the size of that thing?!

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Look what you did! You stupid sonofa-

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Oh, that's gonna work.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You got a better way up?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Any luck?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Well...there's an old service elevator half a mile down the tracks.  Ain't gonna be much use, though.  Lines are dead.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You said those cables're still live. Can't we rewire...?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Oh, man, there you go again.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Those things bring juice to the new stations.  You just can't rewire that shit...

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: For Chrissakes, what's the problem? You need a memo every time you fart?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: All right, motherfucker, that's it.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: I only got...

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Just do it!

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Wait a minute-

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Fuck you, wait a minute. I'm going to-

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Its muscles are locked.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Oh, Jesus!!

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You feel anything?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Yeah, I feel like ripping your fucking eyes out...

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Leonard, listen.  I need to see if there's any nerve damage before we carry you back.  Look, I'm trying to help you here...

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Oh, you helped me here, all right, white boy.  You and your goddam memo. You needed to prove your point, uh?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I'm sorry.  But I don't think letting you bleed to death is the best apology.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: A mistake.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: "Mistake"?  What's that supposed to...?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: It doesn't matter, all right?  It's dead.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: How you know that?  Shit, it was runnin' around with its buttside gone and a fucking pipe through its heart...

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Is there a switch?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Third rail is dead.  Get me up.  There must be a manual override in the booth.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Can we get this car there?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Someone'd have to go to the switchroom, pull the coupling lever, that'll send us left and to the elevator.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: You gonna finally get to fuck around with the wires.  Think you can handle it?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Depends.  You got a memo?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: The kid...

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: The kid's with them!!

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: What do you-?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Go!! Just go!!

turns.speaker: MANNY
turns.text: He's special.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: He can imitate anything, you just watch him.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: My God, what the hell are you...?

turns.speaker: MANNY
turns.text: Hurry, the woman needs help!

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: What are you doing down here?

turns.speaker: MANNY
turns.text: Chuy. He was taken. He's down here somewhere...  Oh, please, hurry. I saw what was after her.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: You better tell me what the hell's going on here!

turns.speaker: MANNY
turns.text: Hey, hey!! Take it easy!!

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: The lights come up, you pull the switch.

turns.speaker: MANNY
turns.text: I pull.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: You don't do that, we're on the wrong track.  You...

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: What's Manny doing? I can't see him anymore.

turns.speaker: MANNY
turns.text: Nino, please...

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: What are you putting that crap on me for?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Scent glands.  Insects use 'em to identify themselves to each other.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: But the power...

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Hell, I might be able to juice the whole area, if I can get to the power box. It's just a couple of cables...

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: It would take a minute or so.  You won't last that long out there.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Peter, you couldn't even fix our TV!

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: He didn't do it!

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Manny never threw the coupling switch!! We're goin' the wrong way!!!

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Which way?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Across both tracks!!

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: We're no leaving you!

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: No way we can outrun 'em together. Move it!

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Just inner chambers...

turns.speaker: MANNY
turns.text: But it look like a man. It... I saw it.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: No...

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Mantids can mimic. We gave the Judas that code...

turns.speaker: MANNY
turns.text: "...and behold he will come that walks as a man, yet is not a man- ..."

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: This, is our baby Peter. Yours and mine. Aren't you proud?

turns.speaker: MANNY
turns.text: He's out there. I heard him. How can he be? This things...

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Manny...

turns.speaker: MANNY
turns.text: I didn't protect him, lady. He trusted me. And I didn't protect him... His father...I lost his father to the streets and now, Chuy...

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: We'll find him. We'll be back and find him.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: A shame.  You looked great tonight.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Please.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You did!

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Do you think we did the right thing?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Taking a cab instead of hiring a limo?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: You know what I mean...

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: We did no impact evaluation.  The consequences of...

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Is this a Catholic guilt thing...?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Who know?  We get lucky, maybe a couple of 'em'll be ours.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: We're down to a "couple" now, huh?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You know where they get this fertility stuff?  They extract it from the urine of menopausal Italian nuns.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Monks bottle their own wine. Don't they?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: You were the one who ran around with ice in his underwear, don't forget that.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Don't get kinky here...

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Okay, meet me out front.  I gotta go. Josh's picking me up in five. see you tonight.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: I'll be late.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Thought it was my week for that.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: I needed to think. It was either this or the weather channel.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: This thing was the size of my fist, Peter!! That's off the charts!

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Okay. So you lost a great specimen-

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Don't you get it? It's more than that.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Evolution doesn't work that fast. Something pushed that thing to take the leap. We need to find another specimen.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: We?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Keep going. We'll tell you when to stop...

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Maybe they lied to you.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Even if they did... that's all we have, isn't it?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Metaxonycha Godmani.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Honey, just leave it.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: No, there's...

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You give someone a fucking uniform and... Did you hear how he talked to us?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: I heard how you talked to him.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Oh, so I'm the bad guy now?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: He was just doing his job.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Fine, then I'm the bad guy. Jesus!

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Great crowd.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: No such thing, baby.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: I get the feeling they came more for the potroast than the apterids.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Fuck 'em.  They don't know what they're missing.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Oh, no, you were-

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: I was just late.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Ironic, don't you think?  These guys can hatch hundreds of offspring in a single clutch of eggs, right? And here we are...

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Susan, we're not b-

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: ...you don't even know what you're looking for.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You said that thing was big as your hand.  I don't think I'm going to miss...

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Why take the chance?  Just let me go down there with you...

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Susan, listen to me:  you handled that insect almost as much as Siri...

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: It didn't bite me.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I know.  But if it was carrying something...there's a chance you could have been exposed.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: It's me. Can you hear me?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Yeah, barely. We haven't found anything down here. Nothing...

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Don't.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Listen to me:  we're getting you out.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: No, Jesus, no.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Toss the flare down!

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: So, you're saying this is like those bugs that -- that look like twigs or leaves or...

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: That's camouflage...

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: His blood! It's driving them crazy! We have to mask the odor!

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: How?!

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: It's no use! They know we're in here!

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: They don't know anything Peter, they just sense. They're hardwired!

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Right. Hardwired to eat anything that's not like them!

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Rub it on the windows!

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: What-

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Just do it!!

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: We'll cover ourselves with this. They can mimic us-  we Goddam mimic them!

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Peter-

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: It worked before...

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: The scent won't last...

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: That's why we should do it now.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Don't touch it.  And for Godsakes, try not to sweat.  They can sense chemical changes...

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Try not to sweat?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I was just thinking how I could use a pair of pliers... and I remembered where they are...

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: That's it. That's it. Breathe easy.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Oh, come on, come on!

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Jump in.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You go first. I'll be right below you.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Your arm, you can't...

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I can.  We can do this...

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: C'mon...

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Ah...

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Talk to me.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Peter...
